business.headline: Why family offices are crucial to India's 'Viksit Bharat by 2047' dream?At the India Today Conclave 2025, Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, discussed the growing role of family offices in India's journey towards becoming a developed economy by 2047. In a session titled "A Case for Tomorrow", moderated by Siddharth Zarabi, Shroff explained why family offices are vital for India's economic expansion and how they can contribute to achieving a Rs 30 trillion GDP target in the coming decades.

US Gold Card visa expensive, not worth it for Indians: Top law firm bossRishabh Shroff, partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, said Donald Trump's $5 million US Gold Card visa does not make sense for Indians as cheaper alternatives are available.

Why are the richest 1% leaving India? Law firm boss Rishabh Shroff explains Rishabh Shroff, Partner at Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas, shared insights into the rising trend of high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs) acquiring foreign passports and moving their wealth abroad.

Pay is based on capability, not gender: Avarna Jain on pay gap in music industryAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Avarna Jain, Vice Chairperson of Saregama, spoke about the role of women in the workforce and addressed the long-debated issue of pay parity in the music and entertainment industry. She stated that in creative fields, women are leading the way, and pay is determined by ability and capability, not gender.

Place of TV will never be taken away: Anu Ranjan on OTTs replacing TVAnu Ranjan, President of The Indian Television Academy, said that television will remain relevant despite the rise of OTT platforms at the India Today Conclave 2025. She explained that while digital streaming services are growing, they cannot replace television, mainly due to affordability and accessibility.

Conclave 2025: Women leaders on breaking barriers, challenges and leadershipAt the India Today Conclave 2025, Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, stated that businesses should be evaluated based on numbers, not gender. Speaking at the session "Breaking Barriers and Building Legacies," Thapar stressed that success in business depends on financial results, not whether a man or woman runs it.

Dalal Street logs best week of 2025. Will positive momentum continue?After a long spell of selling, investors on Dalal Street have finally got some relief. But does this mean the worst is over? Here is all you need to know.

Businesses should be judged by numbers, not gender: Namita Thapar International Women's Day: Namita Thapar, Executive Director of Emcure Pharmaceuticals, highlighted how financial results remain the key factor in business success, regardless of whether a man or a woman runs the company.

Women investors outpacing men in mutual fund investments: ReportThere's a common belief that women prefer safer investments, but the data challenges that view. More women are actively investing in mutual funds and surpassing men in key areas.

These 3 money deadlines you can't miss in March 2025If you want to secure better returns, deposit in these special fixed deposits, which are available only for a limited period. The last date for investing in these schemes is March 31, 2025.

Bengaluru's housing rent crisis triggers online debate. Details hereA recent social media post has ignited debate over Bengaluru's soaring rents, with users sharing how housing costs are outpacing salaries and making city living unaffordable.

ad:tech New Delhi unveils ad:techHonours to recognise marketing tech innovationHeld on March 6 at Yashobhoomi, in collaboration with the International Advertising Association (IAA) India Chapter, this event brought together industry leaders to honour the innovators shaping the future of tech-driven marketing.

Viral: Shawn Mendes sings Senorita on Mumbai street ahead of concertCanadian singer Shawn Mendes, who is currently in India, performed his hit song Senorita on a Mumbai street on Saturday, much to the delight of his fans.
Zahan Kapoor on legacy, Black Warrant, and carving his own path. Watch

Zahan Kapoor reflects on celebrityhood, Kapoor legacy and Black Warrant's successActor Zahan Kapoor opened up about his career, his latest Netflix show, Black Warrant, his famous cousins, and more, at the India Today Conclave 2025 held in New Delhi on Saturday.

Mindy Kaling reacts to criticism of Meghan Markle's With Love, MeghanActor and creator Mindy Kaling has finally reacted to the criticism of Meghan Markle's lifestyle series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on Netflix on March 4.

The Electric State review: Russo Brothers' dystopian film sparks and fizzles outReleased-Fri Mar 14, 2025The Netflix film, 'The Electric State' falls short of entertainment. The chemistry between Millie Bobbie Brown and Chris Pratt looks awkward, while the bots don't do enough to keep the excitement alive.

Nadaaniyan X reviews: Internet shreds Ibrahim-Khushi's film, calls it trashyNadaaniyan, starring Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor, debuts on Netflix to widespread criticism, with viewers and critics alike branding it 'unbearable' and 'trashy'.

Ruby review: A debut album that's ambitious, polished, and unapologetically Jennie Blackpink's Jennie's debut solo album, Ruby, is a bold exploration of her musical identity, featuring 15 tracks that delve into themes of empowerment and self-discovery.

Meghan Markle's With Love, Meghan renewed for season 2 amid criticismThe Duchess of Sussex, Meghan Markle, has announced a second season of her Netflix series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on the OTT giant on March 4.

BB OTT 3 fame Kritika-Armaan Malik's son Zaid diagnosed with ricketsBigg Boss OTT 3 fame Kritika Malik and husband Armaan Malik's son, Zaid has been diagnosed with rickets. The news was shared by Armaan's first wife, Payal Malik, in her latest vlog.

In collaboration with the popular series, Panchayat, the series starring Neena Gupta, Faisal Malik, and others is currently trending at No 1 on YouTube.

general news.headline: Despicable act: India condemns vandalism at Hindu temple in CaliforniaThis latest incident comes less than five months after the BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir in California state capital Sacramento was desecrated with anti-Hindu messages.

India's tariff cuts align with past trade pacts, not Trump pressure: SourcesAccording to sources, the development is seen as part of India's move to significantly reduce its average applied tariffs to key developed countries like Australia, the United Arab Emirates, Switzerland and Norway under a series of recently-concluded bilateral trade agreements.

New-age India take another shot at ODI glory, face New Zealand puzzleChampions Trophy Final: India and New Zealand face each other in a battle of tactics and grit on Sunday. March 9. Will Rohit's 'new-age' ODI template be vindicated against Santner's side?

Sorry Shinde sahib: BMW driver's apology after urinating at Pune traffic stopGaurav Ahuja, caught on video urinating at a Pune traffic stop, recorded an apology before his detention, vowing never to repeat the act.

Udta Kerala now? Drug crisis hits schools, ravages homesKerala thwarted the tide of narcotics even as drug abuse surged globally at various points in history. However, the southern state is now dealing with a drug crisis that seems to be worse than Punjab's. God's Own Country has seen a scary surge in drug-fuelled violence, as synthetic drugs breach the walls of its schools and destroy homes.

Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar admitted to AIIMS after chest pain: ReportVice President Jagdeep Dhankhar was taken to AIIMS around 2 am on Sunday after experiencing uneasiness and chest pain, reports said.

Journalist killed in UP's Sitapur: Bike hit, then shot three times on highwayReportedly, the incident happened when the assailants first rammed into his bike and then shot him three times. It was first seen as an accident but was soon turned into a murder case after doctors at a district hospital discovered three bullet wounds on his body.

J&K government under fire for land given 'free of cost' to ex-Sri Lanka cricketerAccording to reports, former Sri Lankan cricketer Muttiah Muralitharan's company, Ceylon Beverages, has been allotted 25.75 acres for a Rs 1,600 crore bottle-filling and aluminium can-manufacturing unit in Kathua district.

Google employees get to nap after meals: Video gives a glimpse of Gurugram officeIn a now-viral video, a woman offered a glimpse of what life looks like inside Google's Gurugram office. The video has left social media users impressed.

Madhya Pradesh man kills wife, hangs himself; grandfather jumps into his pyreA man in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi district died by suicide by jumping into his grandson's funeral pyre. Earlier, the grandson had killed his wife and hanged himself. Police are investigating the motive behind the killing.

Over 1,000 killed in 2 days of clashes between Syrian forces and Assad loyalistsThe Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said in addition to 745 civilians killed, mostly in shootings from close distance, 125 government security force members and 148 militants with armed groups affiliated with Assad were killed.

Spy camera found in Telangana's girls' hostel, warden arrested Police arrested a hostel warden in Sangareddy district after hidden cameras were found inside phone chargers at a girls' hostel. Forensic teams are reviewing the footage, and legal action will follow based on the investigation.

T20 World Cup victory broke the jinx, we're now hungry to win more: Shubman GillIndia vice captain Shubman Gill said that the T20 World Cup 2024 victory broke the knockout jinx of the team, and they are now they're hungry to add more titles to their cabinet. India are set to lock horns in the final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 against New Zealand on Sunday, March 9 in Dubai.

I watch my T20 World Cup 2024 final catch every day: Suryakumar YadavIndia's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav revealed that he watches his T20 World Cup catch every day. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
